comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,23 +4,23 @@ image: Visual Studio 2017
 
 platform: x64
 
-build:
-  verbosity: minimal
-
 branches:
-  except:
-    - /.*nist.*/
-    - /master-new-.*/
+  only:
+    - master
comment.body: Does this mean we only get AppVeyor builds once we've merged down to master, but not on pull requests?

pull_request.title: KEMS can now be built using CMake.
pull_request.body:
## Build Instructions

To build on UNIX-y systems: `mkdir build && cd build && cmake -GNinja .. && ninja`

To build on Windows: `mkdir build && cd build && cmake -G "NMake Makefiles" .. && nmake"` in the VS Developer console. Alternatively, just running `cmake ..` will generate build files for Visual Studio.

To build shared libraries: `cmake -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON -GNinja ..`
To use (or not use) OpenSSL, pass `-DUSE_OPENSSL={ON|OFF}`
To disable (for example) all SPHINCS variants, pass `-DENABLE_SIG_SPHINCS=OFF`

To run all the tests, invoke `ninja run_tests`
To build documentation, invoke `ninja gen_docs`

## Things left to do:

1) Add all compilation flags after SIKE warnings are dealt with.
2) Add CMake and ninja to CI environments and update the build scripts accordingly.
3) Add the `copy_from_pqclean` templating.
4) Update README.

To disable (for example) all SPHINCS variants, pass `-DENABLE_SIG_SPHINCS=OFF`
